qas.question: What year did the Crimean War begin?
What year did the Crimean War end?
Who controlled the rights of Christian minorities in the Holy Land?
Who promoted the rights of the Catholic people?
Who promoted the rights of the Eastern Orthodox Christians?

context: The Crimean War was a military conflict fought between October <a0_0>1853<a0_0/> – March <a1_0>1856<a1_0/> in which Russia lost to an alliance of France, the United Kingdom, the Ottoman Empire, and Sardinia. The immediate cause involved the rights of Christian minorities in the Holy Land, which was controlled by the <a2_0>Ottoman Empire<a2_0/>. <a3_0>The French<a3_0/> promoted the rights of Catholics, while <a4_0>Russia<a4_0/> promoted those of the Eastern Orthodox Christians. The longer-term causes involved the decline of the Ottoman Empire and the unwillingness of the United Kingdom and France to allow Russia to gain territory and power at Ottoman expense. It has widely been noted that the causes, in one case involving an argument over a key, have never revealed a "greater confusion of purpose", yet led to a war noted for its "notoriously incompetent international butchery."
